sections.purpose: To provide dry heat for sterilization of glassware and drying of chemical samples.
sections.scope: Applicable to laboratory activities in Pharmaceutical Chemistry.
procedure: Check that the oven is clean and the shelves are properly positioned.
Power ON the unit and set the required temperature on the controller.
Allow the oven to stabilize at the set temperature.
Place items on the trays, ensuring they do not touch the oven walls.
Close the door tightly to minimize heat loss.
After the process is complete, turn OFF the heater and wait for cooling.
Open the door slightly to release residual heat before removing items.
Record the temperature and duration in the equipment logbook.
precautions: Do not place flammable chemicals or volatile solvents in the oven.
Avoid overloading the shelves as it restricts air circulation.
Always use tongs or heat-resistant gloves when handling hot items.
Do not use the oven for drying plastic or rubber materials unless specified.
Perform periodic temperature calibration with a certified thermometer.
